contentrichtext.text: <!-- Image with unknown copyright status removed: [[Image:Bonneville Salt Flats Speed racer.jpg|thumb|200px|Gary Gabelich drives the [[Blue Flame (car)|Blue Flame]] to a new [[land speed record]]]] --> '''Gary Gabelich''' (August 29, 1940 â€“ January 26, 1984) was an American race car driver who set the [[land speed record]] with his [[rocket]]-powered vehicle "[[Blue Flame (car)|Blue Flame]]" on October 23, 1970, achieving an [[average]] speed of {{convert|622.287|mi/h|km/h|abbr=on}}. Only 13,000 lbs. thrust was used during this attempt, and a peak speed of {{convert|650|mi/h|km/h|abbr=on}} was momentarily attained (record speed was {{convert|622.407|mi/h|km/h|3|abbr=on}} on a dry lake bed at [[Bonneville Salt Flats]] in Wendover, [[Utah]]. This record was the first over {{convert|1000|km/h|mi/h|0|abbr=on}} and remained unbeaten until 1983, when [[Richard Noble]] broke it driving [[Thrust 2]]. In 1969 he set a drag-boat record of 200.44 miles per hour (322.38 km/h).<ref>http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2457&dat=19840127&id=eyg0AAAAIBAJ&sjid=CeEIAAAAIBAJ&pg=2540,4130331</ref><ref>http://dragboattv.com/gary-gabelich-bio/</ref> Gabelich was seriously injured in the crash of an experimental 4 wheel drive [[Funny Car]]. Gabelich died in January 1984 in a motorcycle crash. Gary was a delivery driver in his younger days for Vermillion's Drug store driving a split window 1960 era VW kombi delivery van. He lived at that time in [[Bixby Knolls]] area of [[Long Beach, CA]]. with his parents. Gary served as an Apollo test astronaut for North American Aviation in 1968-1969 as stated on the plaque his family dedicated to him in 2001<ref>http://s4.photobucket.com/albums/y141/gregwapling/hot-rods-down-under/land-speed-racing-history/gary-gabelich/gary-gabelich-plaque.jpg</ref> Gary and his family appeared on the [[Family Feud]] with [[Richard Dawson]], where he presented the key to the city of Long Beach, Ca. to Dawson. == See also == * [[Land speed record]] ==External links== * [http://www.tomdaniel.com/td_career/td_articles/rocketman_design/rocketman_home.html Blue Flame ] * [http://www.bluebird-electric.net/gary_gabelich.htm Gary Gabelich ] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Gabelich, Gary | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American racing driver | DATE OF BIRTH = August 29, 1940 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = January 26, 1984 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gabelich, Gary}} [[Category:1940 births]] [[Category:1984 deaths]] [[Category:American racing drivers]] [[Category:Land speed record people]] [[Category:Bonneville 300 MPH Club members]] [[Category:American people of Croatian descent]] {{US-autoracing-bio-stub}}
